result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert S Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: -Restitution for Kwik Trip (resulting from Case 22CM48) to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

-Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent. 
-No contact with any Walmart store in Waukesha County. 
-Case 22CM48 is dismissed and read-in. 
-If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

defendant.name: Davis, Robert S

records.addlTxt: Detainer lift confirmation
Filed by Atty. Broze.
records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty. Broze.
Detainer Lift: Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution

8:35 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert S Davis appeared by Zoom video, in custody at Kettle Moraine Correctional.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Robert S Davis.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and confirms with counsel they are prepared to proceed.  Court reviews the offer as listed in the plea questionnaire.  State and Defense confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty.  Court will also order case 22CM48 be dismissed and read into this case.

Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Thompson.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Broze. 
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed Sentence of:

3 Years Imprisonment (Consecutive to any other current sentence)
-	1 Year of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with any Walmart store in Waukesha County.
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription.

RESTITUTION: $126.15 to be paid to Kwik Trip (resulting from case 22CM48);

COSTS:  $278.00 (includes DRGOD surcharge);

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid during term of imprisonment and during extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Broze requests a new plea and sentencing date and that her client be allowed to appear by Zoom video for the next court date.  No objection by the State.  Court will adjourn for plea and sentencing.  Defendant to appear by video from DCI for the next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for August 5, 2022.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
